sen.j: 智鸞（ちらん、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代の法相宗の僧。
sen.e: was a Hosso sect priest during the Nara period.

Chiran (aka Jiran in Korean; years of birth and death unknown) was a priest of Hosso sect of Buddhism (Japanese equivalent of the Chinese Faxiang sect or Dharma-character school), who lived in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 人名・形式・用語を修正しました
sen.e: Chiran (aka Jiran in Korean; years of birth and death unknown) was a priest of Hosso sect of Buddhism (Japanese equivalent of the Chinese Faxiang sect or Dharma-character school), who lived in the Nara period.
He was born in Shilla in ancient Korea.
He was born in ancient Korean Shilla.
He was born in ancient Korean Shilla.

sen.j: 703年（大宝 (日本)3年）智鳳・智雄らとともに入唐し、慈恩大師基（または窺基）の法孫で法相第3祖の濮陽（ぼくよう）大師智周に師事して法相宗を学んだ。
sen.e: In 703 he visited China together with Ho CHI (aka Korean name Jibong) and Yu CHI studied the Hosso sect Tripitaka under high-priest (or possibly a priest named Kuiji) and became a pupil of high-priest Shu CHI at Puyang in China.

In 703, he visited Tang China together with Chiho and Chiyu, studied Faxiang Buddhism under Chishu (Zhizhou in Chinese) the Bokuyo Daishi (Master Puyang), who was a dharma-grandson of Ki (Ji in Chinese, aka Kuiji) the Jion Daishi (Master Cien) and the third generation founder of the Faxiang sect.

sen.e: In 703, he visited Tang China together with Chiho and Chiyu, studied Faxiang Buddhism under Chishu (Zhizhou in Chinese) the Bokuyo Daishi (Master Puyang), who was a dharma-grandson of Ki (Ji in Chinese, aka Kuiji) the Jion Daishi (Master Cien) and the third generation founder of the Faxiang sect.

sen.j: 日本において法相宗を広め、日本法相宗の第3伝とされている。
sen.e: He propagated the Hosso sect in Japan and was the 3rd generation of the Hosso sect in Japan.
Chiyu propagated the Hosso sect in Japan, which was supposedly the third generation transmission of the Japanese Hosso sect.
